means: 使受欢迎( popularize的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Irving popularized the story in a dramatic and embellished account.
sentence.Network_cn: 欧文凭借其生动细致的描写使这篇小说广受欢迎。

sentence.Network_en: Irving Brokaw popularized figure skating in the US.
sentence.Network_cn: 欧文·布罗考在美国引发了花样滑冰热潮。

sentence.Network_en: It was Aristotle who proved the world is round. Plato popularized the concept.
sentence.Network_cn: 亚里士多德证明了地球是圆的，柏拉图普及了这一概念。

the development of this system is a significant reform in compiling the cost estimate , and it establishes a new mode to compile the cost estimate , which should be popularized .该系统的研发是概算编制方法的重大变革，创立了概预算编制的新模式，具有一定的推广应用价值。

these seafarers popularized their goddess of Han population to be an Asian Pacific goddess , then a global goddess of humankind .这些航海人士使天后从一位汉族女神成就为一亚太区的甚至世界性的神祇。

list.abs: 再说，作为约会的对象受欢迎(popular)的女孩，就是所谓的easy girl(立刻答应的女人)。对于当做结婚对象并不好，而做为约会的对象 …
形容人性格的词汇 ... polite 有礼貌的 popular 受欢迎的 practical 实际的.
九年级英语单词表 ... develop 发展 popularity 普及；流行 association 协会.
九年级英语单词表 ... develop 发展 popularity 普及；流行 association 协会.

entry.def: To popularize something means to make a lot of people interested in it and able to enjoy it.

example.ex: Irving Brokaw popularized figure skating in the US.
example.tran: 欧文·布罗考在美国引发了花样滑冰热潮。

entry.def: To popularize an academic subject or scientific idea means to make it more easy to understand  for ordinary people.

example.ex: It was Aristotle who proved the world is round. Plato popularized the concept.
example.tran: 亚里士多德证明了地球是圆的，柏拉图普及了这一概念。
